result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for Bond Modification - defense

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Blum is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $TBD per TBD until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on TBD.  
Reimbursement to be determined. Failure to make payment on the schedule as established above shall result in the remaining balance becoming immediately due. Sheboygan County through its Corporation Counsel, may initiate a lawsuit or other collection action against you to collect the amount due, together with costs.
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.  To receive payment, bill must be submitted within 90 days of withdrawal or case disposition.

Court will appoint an atty. and waives time limits.
